Graphic classes

Description

These classes allow to convert the data from Sequence, Pose and Joint to display them in the Graphic functions. All these classes and their methods should be considered private.

GraphicWindow

Initialisation

class classes.graphic_classes._GraphicWindow(window, height_window_in_meters=3.0)

Defines the size of the display window and allows to convert and scale the coordinates of the joints to be displayed.

New in version 2.0.

Parameters:

  • window (pygame.Surface) – The main pygame Surface containing all the graphic elements.

  • height_window_in_meters (int or float (optional)) – Defines the distance, in meters, represented by the vertical number of pixels of the window (by default: 3).

window

The main pygame Surface containing all the graphic elements, set during the initialisation.

Type:

pygame.Surface

width

The width of the window, in pixels.

Type:

int

height

The height of the window, in pixels.

Type:

int

center_x

The mid-point on the x-axis of the window, in pixels.

Type:

int

center_y

The mid-point on the y-axis of the window, in pixels.

Type:

int

pixel_meter_scale

The real-life distance a pixel represents, in meters. For example, if the window is 1000 pixels vertically, and the parameter height_window_in_meters is set on 1, each pixel will be equivalent to a square of 1 mm × 1 mm.

Type:

float

Methods

_GraphicWindow._convert_x(x, scale=1.0)

Converts the x “real” coordinate to a graphic coordinate to be displayed in the window.

New in version 2.0.

Parameters:

  • x (float) – The value on the x-axis of a coordinate.

  • scale (float, optional) – The scale at which to convert the coordinate. A bigger scale will zoom in on the axis.

Returns:

The coordinate of the pixel on the x-axis of the window.

Return type:

int

_GraphicWindow._convert_y(y, scale=1)

Converts the y “real” coordinate to a graphic coordinate to be displayed in the window.

New in version 2.0.

Parameters:

  • y (float) – The value on the y-axis of a coordinate.

  • scale (float, optional) – The scale at which to convert the coordinate. A bigger scale will zoom in on the axis.

Returns:

The coordinate of the pixel on the y-axis of the window.

Return type:

int
